comments:
BIRT Data - BirtComp.anyOf function does not work as expected.
BirtComp.anyOf( row["STATUS"] , "Shipped", "Disputed" )

Below is the exception in BIRT designer.
 
- A BIRT exception occurred: Error evaluating Javascript expression. Script engine error: Wrapped java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot convert Shipped to type class [Ljava.lang.Object;
 Script source: source, line: 0, text:
BirtComp.anyOf( row["STATUS"] , "Shipped", "Disputed" ). See next exception for more information.
Error evaluating Javascript expression. Script engine error: Wrapped java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot convert Shipped to type class [Ljava.lang.Object;
 Script source: source, line: 0, text:
BirtComp.anyOf( row["STATUS"] , "Shipped", "Disputed" )

Can the implementation be changed to be consistent with the spec. Thanks.
The change will be done in 2.1.1.

The changes are made to four Rhino objects, BirtComp, BirtMath,BirtDateTime,BirtStr. All the method overloads are implemented. BirtComp.anyOf() now accept any number of arguments as far as that number greater than or equals to 2.
